{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3338585,"name":"Floyd Moore","username":"feverittm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/feverittm/{size}/4928_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T17:27:50.650Z","cooked":"

Our team is having issues in our swerve drive chassis where the NavX is continually disconnecting and then reconnecting. I am looking at the InConnection() navx function to see it’s state.

One of the suggested work-arounds will be to run the NavX in Serial mode (kUSB). However, RobotPy does not support the serial connection for the NavX (which also kills our other possible idea of using a NavX Micro).

Any ideas?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T17:27:50.650Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":70.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459466,"topic_slug":"robotpy-navx-is-continually-disconnecting-and-reconnecting","display_username":"Floyd Moore","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14482,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robotpy-navx-is-continually-disconnecting-and-reconnecting/459466/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3338658,"name":"James Ding","username":"twango","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/twango/{size}/181869_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:15:39.510Z","cooked":"

You could be expericing RoboRIO brownouts, which can cause the temporary disconnection of NavX. See NavX Best Practices

Another relevant CD thread if that helps too:

Sudden NAVX disconnections Technical
Is the Navx also connected to the roborio via usb or is it just in the slot? By connecting it by usb it can stay powered on even during a brownout which might be the cause of your shutdowns.
","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:15:39.510Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":27.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459466,"topic_slug":"robotpy-navx-is-continually-disconnecting-and-reconnecting","display_username":"James Ding","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pdocs.kauailabs.com/navx-mxp/guidance/best-practices/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Best Practices | navX-MXP","clicks":6},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/sudden-navx-disconnections/404782/2","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Sudden NAVX disconnections","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56390,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-navx-is-continually-disconnecting-and-reconnecting/459466/2","custom_user_title":"FIRST Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338665,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:19:49.287Z","cooked":"

RobotPy supports anything that the C++ API supports, including serial ports. There just isn’t a useful helper function for it. See the constructor: NavX API — robotpy-navx 2024.1.1 documentation

However, this doesn’t seem to be a common issue, so I would look at other potential solutions as twango suggested.

Also to be clear we have go through these best practices and have connected a secondary power connection from the RoboRio USB to the usb on the NavX. We are looking at battery issues as well.

Simple question: The NavX has a jumper for voltage selection. The RoboRio IO normally runs on 3.3V. Which voltage should this jumper be set to for a RoboRio installation.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:36:32.722Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":14.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459466,"topic_slug":"robotpy-navx-is-continually-disconnecting-and-reconnecting","display_username":"Floyd Moore","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56390,"username":"twango","name":"James Ding","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/twango/{size}/181869_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14482,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robotpy-navx-is-continually-disconnecting-and-reconnecting/459466/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3339204,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-21T02:54:42.903Z","cooked":"
Floyd Moore:

Simple question: The NavX has a jumper for voltage selection. The RoboRio IO normally runs on 3.3V. Which voltage should this jumper be set to for a RoboRio installation.

It doesn’t matter what the NavX is plugged into for what the NavX voltage selection jumper should be set to. It matters what voltage any devices plugged into the NavX require. If you don’t have anything plugged into the NavX, then the jumper setting doesn’t matter.
